page.title: 07Communications in Lorton
page.content: Letters are collected and delivered daily by van from Cockermouth. There is a sub-post office in the shop in High Lorton. Anxiety is felt for its future. The present owner wishes to retire and no one has been able to take over. The public telephone kiosk is not at present under threat of closure though most people have telephones. A Cockermouth newsagent brings daily papers to the High Lorton Shop by 9 a.m. They are called for. The Low Lorton shop provides a similar service for Sunday papers. The popular weekly local papers are Times & Star, Cumberland News and Keswick Reminder. The Parish Magazine published monthly by the Parochial Church Council reports all village activities in addition to its coverage of church news. All television channels are received - radio reception is good.
